news_header: Exercise improves fat tissue quality in overweight individuals, reducing fat accumulation in the liver and heart.
news_text: A recent study indicates that exercise enhances the quality of fat tissue in overweight individuals, which is beneficial for their health. Regular exercisers showed improved fat storage capabilities in their fat cells, leading to less fat being deposited in the liver and heart, areas where it can cause health issues. The study, conducted by researchers at the University of Michigan, compared two groups of overweight individuals: one that exercised regularly and another that did not. The findings revealed changes in protein composition, increased blood vessels, and reduced inflammatory cells in the fat cells of those who exercised. The research, published in Nature Metabolism, aims to expand understanding of the health benefits of exercise, even if it doesn't lead to weight loss.
